div.note: The prolog͗e of þᵉ cookꝭes tale
div.l: As is the hyve / ful of hony swete
Wel was the wenche / with hym mete
At eủery bl bl bridale / wolde he synge and hoppe
He loved bettir the taverne / than the shoppe
For whan ther any revel / was in chepe
Out of the shoppe / thedir wolde he lepe
Til that he hadde / al the sith I seyn
And daıı̄unced wel / he wolde nat com ageyn
And gadred hym a meny / of his sort
To hoppe ⁊and synge / and make such disport
And ther they settyn / stevene for to meete
To pleyen at the dys / in such a streete
For in towne / nas ther no prentys
That fayrere cowde cast / a peyre a dys
Than perkyn cowde / ⁊and therto he was fre
Of his dispence / in place of pryvite
That fond his maistir / wel in his chaffare
Ful oftyn tyme / he fond his box ful bare
For sikirly / a prentys and a reuelour
That haıı̄untith dys / ryot or paramour
His maistir shal / it in his shoppe abeye
Al have he no part / of the menstralsye
For thefte and ryot / they ben couertible
Al konne he pley / on gyterne or ribible
Revel and trewthe / as in a lowe degre
They ben ful wroth al day / as men may see
This Ioly prentys with his maystir bood
Til he were nyh / out of his prentys hood
Al were he snybbid / bothe erly and late
And som tyme lad / with revel to newgate
But at the laste / his maistir hym bithouht
Vp on a day whan / he his papyr souht
Of a ꝓprouerblreꝓprouerbreꝓprouerble that seith the same word
Wel bettir is rotyn Appil / out of hord
Than it rote / al the remenaıı̄unt
